You are already an hour behind schedule as is.

The dining room table is in sight and all you have to do is figure out a way to get up the table. There is no table cloth that you can climb, no animal that could help you out like in “Honey I Shrunk the Kids,” and no materials you could make a glider or some crazy contraption out of like they do in cartoons. This is a real problem. Your brain works furiously to find a solution to this problem, but nothing is forthcoming.

This is especially frustrating since you can see a bowl full of jelly beans on the table. They are the size of large rocks to you but you are certain you could lift them and make some sort of message to let others know about your situation. You are so close to getting help. If only you could figure out how to get on top of that table you would at least find safety with the residents of your house.

You begin to walk around the table. There really is no point to it. You just do not know what else to do. Maybe you will find out what to do if you look at the table from every angle. There might be something on the floor that you did not see on the floor from your previous point of view. It is not like it can hurt to walk around the table. Besides, if you cannot find anything this is as good a place as any to try to get someone’s attention. And if they do not notice you, you can always run under the table for safety.
1431.title: No Help

choices: Somebody comes in and notices you.
Somebody comes in and doesn’t notice you.
14311.content:
As you walk around the table a wicker trash basket comes into view. You had completely forgotten about that thing. It should be easy enough for even you to climb. The thing is actually close enough to the low table that you might be able to make the jump from the trash basket to the table. That does not seem ideal since you still have a sizable gap to jump and the fall would be fatal if you missed.

It would also be fatal if someone were to accidentally step on you while you were wandering around on the floor. Climbing that basket would be the best thing to do for now. The reeds the basket is made of are the size of logs to you and you would think that would make the basket easy to climb. That is not the case since the reeds are also very smooth and it feels like you are constantly on the verge of slipping as you climb. You do manage to make it to the top of the basket after a few minutes of struggling. Then all you have to do is muster your courage to jump from the basket to the table.

You note that the jump did not seem as long from the ground. The first time you try to make the jump your legs do not cooperated and you stay right where you are. You take a few seconds to breath before your next attempt. When you jump you actually manage to make it across the gap without much trouble. There is at least a foot between you and the edge of the table. At least something has been easy enough to do today.

Next, you head toward the bowl of jellybeans you had spotted earlier. You climb into the bowl and try lifting one of the jellybeans. They are heavy, not as heavy as a rock of equal size, but heavy nonetheless. You start tossing them over the side of the bowl so you do not have to keep climbing into the bowl. When that is accomplished you finally climb out of the bowl and think about what type of message you should make.

There is no need for a complicated message. If you arrange the jellybeans in the shape of an arrow, that should be enough. It would just take too much time and effort to actually spell out a message. After the first few minutes you start to get tired. Lifting all these jellybeans is backbreaking work. You are having trouble lifting the beans by the time you get to the end of the arrow. The quality of your design suffers as a result, but it still looks like an arrow.

Now all you have to do is sit down and wait for someone to notice you. It should not be that long before everyone in the house starts to wake up. Your girlfriend is up and about as well. She could come in here and notice the arrow and you at any second.
14311.title: Making A Message

143112.content:
It does not take long for Anna to show up. She is carrying a steaming coffee cup as she walks into the room and she is walking straight toward the table you are on. You think she should notice you sitting on the table. Then someone else walks into the room as well. It is your friend Charlie. Just as Anna is about to look at were you are Charlie says, “Good Morning Anna.”

She turns around to say good morning to Charlie as she sets down her coffee cup. The coffee cup lands on some of the jelly beans that made up your message. Anna was not expecting the cup to sit at an angle and one of her fingers caught on the edge of the cup as she lifted her hand away. The contents of the cup spilled. You were hit by a wall of hot coffee and it washed you over the side of the table.

There are rollercoaster’s that have more extreme drops than this one, but you always know that you are secured on a rollercoaster. The shock of getting hit by the burning hot coffee stifled your attempts to scream. Your heart felt like it was about to burst as you rushed down to the ground. Then you hit the ground and bounced of the carpet a couple of times. You were surprised to see that you had survived. Not only that, it seemed like you would only get a couple of bruises from the landing. You had no broken bones whatsoever. It hurt a great deal, but it was still possible to walk away from the landing.

You did just that too. Anna was cursing to herself for being so clumsy. Both she and Charlie rushed off to the kitchen to get something to clean the mess up with. You did not want to be in the area of the mess when they started cleaning up. They would be in such a rush to keep the stain from getting too bad they might not notice you there. Besides, you could tell the coffee had stained your clothes brown and you might just look like a bug to people that did not look at you for more than two seconds.

It looks like it is time to hide under the couch until they are finished cleaning up. You might be able to get their attention later, when they are looking down to see how well they have cleaned up the mess. The sound of Anna and Charlie’s feet can be heard pounding off to the kitchen as you run to hide under the couch. They return a few seconds later with towels and a couple cans of spot removers. You observe them as they furiously scrub the carpet. It takes a few minutes before they are satisfied with their work.

“So, do you see any spot on the carpet,” Anna asked Charlie.

“I can’t see anything wrong,” Charlie responded.

This is the moment you think. They are inspecting the carpet and they should be able to notice you. You step out from under the couch and start screaming their names. They seem to notice you but there is a strange look on their faces. You hope that is just their reaction to them seeing you shrunk.
143112.title: The Spill

choices: Try to make it back to location of the party.
1431122.content:
“Oh my God, that spider is huge,” Anna says.

“Wow, that is a big one,” Charlie responds.

You are startled and look around for the spider they are talking about. A spider just might be large enough to be a threat to you now. But, as you look around you do not see any other living thing around you. Then a shadow surrounds you and you look up just in time to see Charlie’s foot about to slam down on you. There is just enough time for you to jump out of the way.

This is strange. They were looking straight at you and yet they still managed to mistake you for a spider. You were small, but they should have been able to tell you were human after looking straight at you. No time to think about that now though. It looks like Charlie and Anna are going to try their hardest to end your life.

The safety of the couch is not that far away from you, but Charlie and Anna are going to get a couple of tries at crushing you. You sprint for the couch while trying to watch out for giant feet. Anna is the first one to take a shot at you. Her aim is a little off and you do not even have to try and avoid her foot. Charlie makes a go at you but Anna’s foot gets in the way and you are safe once more. It does not look like they are good at coordinating their efforts. They prove that when they try to step on you at the same time and end up kicking each other as you run under the couch.

They should not bother you now that you are under the couch. There are not many people that would go through with the effort of killing a spider once it manages to get away. Now that you have a moment to think you take the time to do so. It appears that you are not only the size of a bug, you look like one to normal sized people as well. That means you probably will not be getting any help from anyone anytime soon. What will you do now though?

There are a few options left available to you. Some people in this house sleep very late. If you could get to someone’s room before they woke up you might be able to climb up to their ear and get a chance to talk to them before they get a chance to look at you. The other thing you could do is try to make your way back to the house were the party was. There might be clues about what happened to you there. There were a few problems with both situations. If you looked like a spider to people it also meant you might not be able to communicate with them as well. The journey to the house was going to be incredibly dangerous as well. There were bound to be uncountable dangers on the journey to that house and unless you could manage to catch a ride there it would take a couple of days to get there on foot.
1431122.title: You Look Different

1432.content: You turn around and are barely able to see the heel of a giant foot heading into the bathroom door only a few meters away from you. It can't be that hard to get their attention in the tiny bathroom, especially if you got on their feet. You knew your girlfriend was ticklish on her feet, that would make it perfect. Although you ran the risk of it being a guy you knew you had to try. Once again you reach the bottom of the door, and have no problem slipping under the door. You saw the feet on the ground, as you walked further in you notice the person is in fact sitting down. and when you finally enter all the way you look up, nearly cringing your neck, to see the face of. . .
1432.title: Try to get the giant's attention.

choices: Your girlfriends hand as she tips you out into it
Autumn's black tounge wrigling as you fall to her open mouth
144.content:
You head to the kitchen in search of food, once you eventually get there you find a half eaten pack of chips on the counter, just salted flavour but youve not got much choice at the moment.
You climb up and crawl into the pack, beginning to eat when 2 people come in, you recognise the voices. Its your girlfriend and autumn the goth girl from her sorority. Just then one of them lifts the pacm up, you look out the opening to see...
144.title: Go to the kitchen to grab a quick bite to eat

145.content: How about trying to find one of your family members to get some help?
145.title: Family ties

info.description:
Rules
1) Have fun
2) No minimum chapter length
3) Please make sense from one chapter to the next, if I can't put your chapter into context with what has gone before I will delete it
4) Please Add if you read
5) If you add/review me I'll respond in kind or if you prefer I'll give GP, email me to ask for the latter

Cast(Will be updated as seems necessary):

You, A 20-something male college student who was out for a good time last night, but got a ‘little' more than you expected.

Anna ‘Morning' Glory, your 2 year's older than you girl friend. She is a fiery red head, with a slightly pale complexion, and lips redder than fire.

Melissa Abernathy, a cute blonde in Anna's sorority, though certainly not the one from last night. She's the college's blonde superstar, who has that annoying, yet somehow adorable laugh of most ‘true to their soul' blondes.

Autumn ‘Candy' Stephenson, a goth chick, and not someone you'd normally know, but she's in Anna's sorority so you've seen her around. Skin pasty white thanks to no sun, and everything else, from nails, to hair, and even her tongue, dyed black as sin.

Lora, you don't know her last name, as she rarely leaves her room in the sorority house. Exactly what she does in there, you have no idea, but you've always kinda thought she might be building a nuke or something.

Charlie Orman, another guy going to you college, who is about you age, give or take a few months. He has blonde hair, though it's shaved so low he might as well be bald. Other than that he has little to distinguish him from hundreds of similar students, except that he rents the room next to your's in your parent's house.
